content:
I've updated the game with the fix mentioned here:
https://www.codingame.com/forum/t/bug-in-langtons-ant/177679

https://www.codingame.com/replay/394436028
The last game is never played?

Found some typos, i'm not a native speaker, but this sounds better to me

Objectif -> Objective
The game is played in two times -> The game is played in two stages
colored with our color ->  colored with your color
If the ant exit the grid -> If the ant leaves the grid

I think that matches should go by pair (as positions first player / second player are not equivalent) :
There should always be two matches together between the 2 selected players:

First player A - Second player B (match 1)
First player B - Second player A (match 2)

I like this puzzle very much ! Thank you !

It would be great to add some manual game parameters for :
- dimension
- number_rounds
- pathLength

The game seems very nice!
However, one detail disturbs me: rows and columns seem to be reversed.

What do the leagues do? There does not appear to be any functional differences, but yet the description is different in some of them (e.g. "both players" is pluralized in some leagues but "both player" in others). If the intention is to have stages to separate well-performing players from the beginners, you might want to start with just a few leagues and update the game to have more leagues afterwards (like once a week or something)

I like this the game already. 

But as a little suggestion, maybe you could add a "pin" in the replay for when the ant starts moving. (just like how in locam you have it for when the battle starts). 

So you can quickly jump to the overview with all the tiles filled and before the ant moves.

Anway, thank you for the contribution :)

I like the idea!

When testing, the title appears not very nicely as : 
Langton's Ant - Niveau 1

Thank you for this puzzle :)

A remark : You can try all leagues selecting them in the upper right corner of the IDE.
I say this because I see submission only on the first league and it's not the most interesting.

It also crashes if I print out of bounds coordinates:



The game has crashed. Please contact the author and enclose the following error:

java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 30
	at com.codingame.game.Referee.gameTurn(Referee.java:255)
	at com.codingame.gameengine.core.GameManager.start(GameManager.java:122)
	at com.codingame.gameengine.core.RefereeMain.start(RefereeMain.java:69)
	at com.codingame.gameengine.core.RefereeMain.main(RefereeMain.java:52)

Fixed. 
Thanks a lot for your help.

I have a question  : How to edit details of a contribution ?

Nice, a new contribution :)
Any reason for not allowing us to download the sourcecode?

When I print "0":

The game has crashed. Please contact the author and enclose the following error:

java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException: 1
	at com.codingame.game.Player.getAction(Player.java:16)
	at com.codingame.game.Referee.gameTurn(Referee.java:252)
	at com.codingame.gameengine.core.GameManager.start(GameManager.java:122)
	at com.codingame.gameengine.core.RefereeMain.start(RefereeMain.java:69)
	at com.codingame.gameengine.core.RefereeMain.main(RefereeMain.java:52)
You have weird spaces after "Line 2" and "Line 3" right before the colon; "Two integer" should be plural; "et" is weird and I assume you want "and"
Fixed, thanks you

Good idea, I added it.

Thank you :)

My intention is to propose at the beginning 5 leagues : 2 solos and a first easy boss for duels in order to understand the game (woods leagues)  and 2 others bosses a little harder but not for elite players.
Later I can add some harder if the challenge is appreciated.

It's better to do otherwise ?
I don't find where row and columns are reversed. Can you tell me where you see it please ?

It's not possible in multiplayers games as we can do in In/Out puzzles.

I choose to fix this three parameters but I can randomize them for higher leagues. Do you think it can be more interesting ?

I have already thought about this but I donâ€™t find how easily do this but I think that the random choice of the position of a player will not impact his ranking. 

Althought, I will search again how to do this. 

Thanks for your remarks
Fixed, thank you :)
This strategy is ever use for some puzzles on CG. Maybe it is a parameter they can add easily ?

in vindinium, it has been done (I don't know how) : see https://www.codingame.com/ide/puzzle/vindinium , "Advanced Details"

I have a last (important) suggestion : you should give the first player inside inputs (it would make easier the ant simulation for the 3rd league)

Thanks for the link. I will look at it.

What do you mean by inside inputs ?

"inside inputs" : I mean to give it at the same time as "dimension", "number_rounds" and "path_length" (initial inputs).

I think these three parameters have to be randomized (maybe from the 2nd league) to avoid hard coded strategies.

You are right, it will be better to randomize.

I don't understand your inside inputs : It's to give the player if he is the first ? He can know this using first opponentRow (if it's -1).

" It's to give the player if he is the first " : yes, that what I mean. I agree that it can be retrieved but it's not straightforward (as opponentRow is an input given each turn). In my mind, it's typically what makes a game easy to play.
for example : (13  3) corresponds to the bottom left, but usually it corresponds to the top right
Ah ok, I understand. That's because you take the coordinates (x y) but I use here row and columns (because that's more natural using grid).

ok, I didn't pay enough attention.
In order to improve comprehension :
- you may print row 13 col 3
- you may adapt the ant' color (white / blue / yellow)
Ok, thanks for your remarks :)
